name: Morris Teitelbaum
notes: Owned a restaurant/tavern and bottled seltzer in Cushow, Hungary. Emigrated to the U.S. ~1921–1922 with family.

name: Ethel Sempliner
notes: Matriarch of the Teitelbaum family; emigrated from Hungary; remained close with children after Morris’s death.

name: Sophie Teitelbaum Marks Curkovich
notes: Emigrated to the U.S. to marry; lived in Standish, Michigan; successful in real estate, estate sales, and mortgages.

name: Henry Teitelbaum
notes: Married through a matchmaker; family emigrated from England; no children.

name: Selina Teitelbaum Heisler
notes: Close-knit gatherings with siblings and cousins in NJ; Greenwood Lake picnics.

name: Louis Heisler
notes: NJ family line; children Beth and Sandee Lynn.

name: Sandee Lynn Heisler
notes: Whitman family line.

name: Magda (Margaret) Teitelbaum Schlesinger
notes: Met Eugene at MUNKOS OTHUN; central link between Teitelbaum and Schlesinger branches.

name: Dorothy Claire Schlesinger (Swerbilov) Seeber
notes: Corresponded daily with Boris for four years during his Air Force service; worked while Boris finished school; later returned to college evenings.

name: Kathryn Seeber Magdar Reuter
notes: Descendant line through Magdar/Reuter.

name: Ralph J. Schlesinger
notes: Children Terri (with Richard Kim) and Wendy (with Jordan Bentley/Brian Rupp).

name: Joan Ruth Schlesinger
notes: Children include Jill (with David Israel), Jeffrey (adopted; with Wendy Baker), Eric (with Daphna Ascoli Baker).

name: Julius (Gyula) Schlesinger
notes: Budapest; died of tuberculosis; children orphaned and split among relatives.

name: Ilka Heimler Schlesinger
notes: Died of tuberculosis; children rotated among relatives for meals and lodging.

name: Carl (Calman) Schlesinger
notes: Eldest; tinsmith; emigrated first; co-founded Pollak Manufacturing in Kearny, NJ; sponsored siblings to the U.S.

name: Robert Schlesinger
notes: Descendant line with Betsy Marks.

name: Jean Schlesinger
notes: Children: Peter (with Mariel Sibug), Barbara (with Larry Willis).

name: Julia (Jolan) Schlesinger
notes: Never married; self-supporting; owned infants’ and children’s clothing store; helped finance relatives’ education.

name: Alex (Sandor) Schlesinger
notes: WWI service; wounded; health issues; later immigrated via Canada; bookkeeper at Pollak; fine bridge player; no children; died of tuberculosis.

name: Eugene (Jeno’) Schlesinger
notes: Partner at Star Stationery Co.; met Magda at MUNKOS OTHUN.

name: Morris Endervelt
notes: Emigrated from Poland (1904); family faced financial hardship in NYC; children worked young.

name: Gussie Fishman Endervelt
notes: Matriarch; raised family under difficult conditions in the U.S.

name: Nancy Kate Endervelt
notes: Worked as cashier/bookkeeper at Namm’s; talented singer; later focused on raising family.

name: Jack Endervelt
notes: Line includes Joel, Carrie, Aron Weiner via Cynthia & Morris Weiner; Stacy Joy Weiner (Yoel Tobin) and Yoni Meitav.

name: Betty (Billie) Endervelt
notes: Studied piano with Leopold Damrosh; later worked with San Francisco Opera singers.

name: Al Endervelt
notes: Descendants include Bruce and Robert Sauer.

name: Dorothy Endervelt
notes: Worked in family bakery; married Isidor Thompson; daughter Jackie married Howard Marylander.

name: David Endervelt
notes: Youngest; able to attend college thanks to siblings’ support.

name: Eliazar Swerbilov
notes: Orsha, Russia; limited records; one son remained in Russia.

name: Hanetta Polikoff Swerbilov
notes: Family connected through Orsha Young Friends Benevolent Society in Brooklyn.

name: Solomon (Sol) Swerbilov
notes: Journeyman typographer; supported widowed sister Molly and nieces; summers in Lake Hiawatha, NJ.

name: Jack Swerbilow
notes: Tailor; owned men’s clothing store in Annapolis serving civilians and Naval Academy; WWII Air Force pilot son Bernard.

name: Molly (Aunt Vita) Swerbilov
notes: Widowed early; supported by brother Solomon; daughters’ lines include Koffler, Wanschel, Klein, Leeb.

name: Boris (Swerbilov) Seeber
notes: Air Force service; daily correspondence with Dorothy; changed surname to Seeber during law school; practiced law; died young after seeing first grandchildren.
